sentences.english: The dimples of encouragement are good for me and you.
sentences.chinese: 鼓励的笑靥于你我大有裨益。

sentences.english: The original smile, then full of scars.
sentences.chinese: 原先笑靥如花，后来满是伤疤。

sentences.english: The bond maid peeps out to very naughtily smile dimple.
sentences.chinese: 小丫头露出顽皮的笑靥。

sentences.english: My eyes see nothing but misery; I need to see your sweet smile.
sentences.chinese: 我的眼中除了迷茫别无它物，我要见你的笑靥。

sentences.english: Mary has two dimples when she smiles.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽笑时露出两个笑靥。

sentences.english: Happy smile, full of obsession with the cause.
sentences.chinese: 幸福的笑靥，盛满了对事业的痴迷。

sentences.english: Dimple like flower, lips gently in yours cheeks.
sentences.chinese: 笑靥如花，轻轻的吻在你的脸颊。
一个微笑使她脸上露出笑靥。

sentences.english: It is the tear of the earth that keep her smile in bloom.
sentences.chinese: 大地之上还摇曳着的清泪，更显出它现在的笑靥如花。

sentences.english: There wasn't enough and you still had reasons to smile.
sentences.chinese: 看上去很困顿你却依然有理由面带笑靥。

sentences.english: Her face dimpled as she smiled.
sentences.chinese: 她一笑，脸上露出了笑靥。

sentences.english: She smiled slightly, revealing two beautiful dimples on her cheeks.
sentences.chinese: 她微微一笑，脸上露出两个美丽的笑靥。

sentences.english: You are facing the day you smile.
sentences.chinese: 你素面朝天你笑靥如花。

sentences.english: Couldn't I stop the glittering straw of the sun from tasting your smile?
sentences.chinese: 我怎能阻止阳光的金色麦管不让它吸饮你甜甜的笑靥？

sentences.english: I can see the angels' smile.
sentences.chinese: 抬眼就看到天使的笑靥。

definition: tender and beautiful/also written 嬌艷|娇艳
(of a woman, a flower etc) delicate colors
autumn ripples/(fig.) luminous eyes of a woman/amorous glance
